«~Non est Deus.~»^ The fool said in his: et abominábiles facti sunt in iniqŭitátibus~; non est qŭi fáciat bonum. ^ They are corrupted
"There is no God.": and become abominable in iniquities~; there is none that doth good.

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 3 ^ Deus de caĕlo prospéxit super fílios hòminum
"There is no God.": aŭt requírens Deum. ^ God looked down from heaven on the children of men
column4: to see if there were any that did understand

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 4 ^ Omnes declinavérunt~; sìmul inútiles facti sunt~; non est qŭi fáciat bonum
«~Non est Deus.~»^ The fool said in his: non est usqŭe ad unum. ^ All have gone aside~; they are become unprofitable together~; there is none that doth good
qŭi dévorant plebem meam ut cìbum panis~? ^ Shall not all the workers of iniquity know
"There is no God.": who eat up my people as they eat bread~?

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 6 ^ Deum non invocavérunt~; illic trepidavérunt timóre
«~Non est Deus.~»^ The fool said in his: ubi non èrat tìmor. Qŭóniam Deus dissipávit òssua eórum qŭi homìnibus placent~; confúsi sunt
"There is no God.": qŭóniam Deus sprevit eos. ^ They have not called upon God~; there have they trembled for fear
column4: where there was no fear. For God hath scattered the bones of them that please men~; they have been confounded

1 ^ Dixit insápiens in corde suo: 7 ^ ¿~Qŭìs dabit ex Sióne salutáre Israhélis~? Qŭum convertúerit Deus captivitátem plebis suaĕ
"There is no God.": et laĕtábitur Isráhel. ^ Who will give out of Sion the salvation of Israel~? When God shall bring back the captivity of his people
